Posts.Title: Having a mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi everyone. I was diagnosed with stage 2 breast cancer on 1 august. Ive had a lumpectomy and 2 nodes removed but they found a tiny amount of non invasive cancer cells. So had another op last week and again they found more non invasive cancer cells. Ive pretty much decided to now have a mastectomy and would really like to hear your experiences in this area. I dont need any more nodules removed and they only found a tiny bit of cancer in the first one. So im counting myself very lucky indeed!! Thanks guys xx

Posts.Title: Having a mastectomy

Posts.Content: Hi C I had my mastectomy 2 weeks ago today. I was a day patient so had to go back last week to have it drained and will again next monday. Im still pretty exhausted after small tasks but it was my third op in 8 weeks as had 2 lumpectomys. Dont worry bout feeling tired be gentle with yourself and take one day at a time. Definately check your temperature just incase of infection. Cold and shivery could be shock after the op but could be infection. You can get other strong painkillers but they do have side effects paracetamol is working for me. Anyway good luck on your journey and take care  Helen xx
